Description: Serpentine shabti of Mentuemhat with a lappet-wig, a modelled face with a beard and parallel hands holding two hoes and the string of the seed-basket that hangs over the shoulder; the leg section is inscribed with nine rows of Hieroglyphic text.
Condition: fair - damage to the foot and face
Associated places: Named in inscription: Thebes (historic - Upper Egypt)
